intro: Dissochaeta celebica, commonly known as the Celebes dissochaeta, is a flowering plant native to the Indonesian archipelago. It belongs to the grass family, Poaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are linear and often have a slightly hairy surface, while the flowers are wind-pollinated. Dissochaeta celebica is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
